headline: Unit Chief at ICE
summary: Experienced Unit Chief with a demonstrated history of working in Financial Management for DHS law enforcement programs.  Strengths in Budgeting, Analytical Skills, Government, Public Finance, and Project Management.

defaultPosition.description: Mr. Maiwurm supervises a four person team that work across budget formulation, budget execution, metrics and special projects of a +$2 billion portfolio relating to Homeland Security Investigations, the Office of Intelligence, and the Student Exchange and Visitation Program.
defaultPosition.title: Unit Chief

positions.description: Mr. Maiwurm supervises a four person team that work across budget formulation, budget execution, metrics and special projects of a +$2 billion portfolio relating to Homeland Security Investigations, the Office of Intelligence, and the Student Exchange and Visitation Program.
positions.title: Unit Chief

positions.description: Mr. Maiwurm supervised a three person team that work across budget formulation, budget execution, metrics and special projects of a $1.1 billion portfolio relating to the Federal Air Marshals, the Office of Global Strategies, and the Office of Security Policy and Industry Engagement.
positions.title: Unit Chief

positions.description:
Mr. Maiwurm entered ICE in 2008 as a junior analyst. He grew quickly into being the lead analyst for two programs with budgets in excess of a billion dollars for the chief financial officer. His work has been across budget formulation, budget execution, special projects, project management, and pricing detention contracts. 

He worked as a Team Lead for federal Budget Analysts and a Project Manager for contract staff who review the fiscal impact of ICE's Enforcement and Removal Operations.
positions.title: Team Lead and Project Manager

positions.description: Mr. Maiwurm managed a 26 person kitchen shift staff in a multicultural, multilingual environment on a food services contract at a Coalition Air Force Base.  The food services contract served food to Air Force staff stationed in Kyrgyzstan as well as troops rotating in and out of Operation Enduring Freedom.  Typically the contract served 100,000+ meals per month.
positions.title: Supervisor

positions.description:
Mr. Maiwurm taught English to Junior High students and co-coached the basketball team at Jangy-Jer School.  During his service he wrote and implemented a $3,000 grant that fixed the floor of the school gymnasium.  

Additionally, Mr. Maiwurm was selected by his peers to act as the Chui region Warden for Security.  Mr. Maiwurm authored and briefed emergency action protocol to the other Peace Corps Volunteers in his region.  During Kyrgyzstan's revolution in 2005 every volunteer implemented the protocol and was successfully consolidated in safe houses in the capital city of Bishkek.
positions.title: Volunteer
